DataElement.preferredName: Mutation Abnormality KRAS Gene Assessment Stratification Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The stratification code for the assessment of any transmissible change in the KRAS gene, a gene involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The assessment of any transmissible change in the KRAS gene, a gene involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.:This gene is involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

Concepts.definition: Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.
This gene is involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: KRAS Gene Mutation Abnormality Stratification Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The stratification code for a transmissible change in the genetic material of the KRAS gene, a gene is involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 12 in the GTPase KRas protein where glycine has been replaced by cysteine.

Concepts.definition: A change in the amino acid residue at position 12 in the GTPase KRas protein where glycine has been replaced by cysteine.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/05/2015. Added p. to VM name by CDDP/CTSP request. mc 10/12/16

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: This gene is involved in signal transduction and apoptosis.

Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
